gmi
Interface ExternalGMIListener

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public interface ExternalGMIListener
extends java.io.Serializable

In GMI package, an external interface is an interface that declare a set of methods implemented by an object group that may be invoked from a remote Java virtual machine. An external remote interface must satisfy the following conditions:

  • It must at least extend, either directly or indirectly, the interface ExternalGMIListener.
  • in addition to any application-specific exceptions
The ExternalGMIListener is a marker interface that declares no methods.

Author:
Gurvinder Singh
